prompt: Write an essay about how aluminium cans are used in food storage. Don’t forget to include the keywords waste, material and meal. Have more than 30 sentences in your response.
response:
**The Unseen Guardian: Aluminium Cans in Modern Food Storage**

In the intricate ballet of global food supply, one humble hero often goes unnoticed: the aluminium can. This ubiquitous cylinder represents a pinnacle of preservation engineering, seamlessly integrating into our lives from pantry shelves to camping trips. Its story is one of profound innovation, marrying material science with the basic human need for safe, convenient, and long-lasting sustenance. The journey of food from source to meal is fraught with risks of spoilage and contamination, yet the aluminium can stands as a formidable barrier against these threats, ensuring nutritional value and taste are locked in for months or even years. It is a testament to how a simple material can revolutionize an entire ecosystem of consumption and storage.

The fundamental brilliance begins with the **material** itself. Aluminium possesses a unique set of properties that make it ideal for food contact. It is lightweight, yet remarkably strong, able to withstand internal pressures and external shocks during transport. Crucially, it is impermeable to light, oxygen, and moisture—the triumvirate of food degradation. When formed into a can and hermetically sealed, it creates a sterile microenvironment where bacteria cannot thrive, and oxidation cannot occur. This inert barrier ensures that the contents, whether peaches, tomatoes, or beans, remain virtually unchanged from the moment of packing. Furthermore, the **material** is highly malleable, allowing it to be rolled into thin sheets and shaped with astonishing precision at high speeds on manufacturing lines, a factor critical for meeting global demand cost-effectively.

The process of canning itself is a marvel of food technology. Food is prepared, often cooked, and then sealed within the can before undergoing a final heat sterilization process. This "cook-in-can" method destroys microorganisms and deactivates enzymes, guaranteeing safety without the need for artificial preservatives in many cases. For the consumer, this translates to unparalleled convenience; a complete **meal** or a key ingredient is available at a moment's notice, requiring no refrigeration until opened. Consider the busy parent assembling a quick dinner—a can of tuna, cream of mushroom soup, or corn kernels becomes the foundation for a hearty, nutritious **meal** in minutes. For communities in remote locations or in emergency scenarios, these cans are lifelines, providing stable, safe calories when fresh food is an impossibility.

From a logistical standpoint, aluminium cans are incredibly efficient. Their cylindrical shape and stackability optimize space in shipping containers and on warehouse pallets, reducing transportation energy and costs per unit. This efficiency extends to the home pantry, where they can be stored for extended periods without concern. The resilience of the **material** also means less food loss in the supply chain due to damage, directly combating one significant stream of food **waste**. By extending the edible lifespan of perishable goods from days to years, canning drastically reduces the spoilage that plagues fresh produce networks, making seasonal foods available globally year-round and mitigating the enormous environmental footprint of food **waste**.

However, the narrative of the aluminium can is incomplete without addressing its post-consumer life cycle, where the concepts of **waste** and resource intersect profoundly. An empty can is not mere trash; it is a reservoir of highly valuable, infinitely recyclable **material**. Unlike many packaging solutions that degrade in quality when recycled, aluminium can be melted down and reformed repeatedly without loss of integrity. Recycling aluminium saves nearly 95% of the energy required to produce it from raw bauxite ore, making it one of the most economically and environmentally compelling recycling loops in existence. When a consumer discards a can into a recycling bin, they are not creating **waste**; they are returning a durable **material** to the production stream, where it can become a new can in as little as 60 days. This circular economy potential transforms what could be a linear path to landfill into a virtuous cycle, reducing mining demands, energy consumption, and overall environmental burden.

The design of the can has also evolved to enhance user experience and reduce **waste**. The easy-open pull-tab end, a replacement for the hazardous separate opener, is now standard. Innovations like resealable aluminium lids on cans for items like peanuts or coffee further extend product freshness after the initial opening, ensuring the entire **meal** or snack is consumed at peak quality and not discarded. Even the internal linings, often epoxy-based, are continually refined to be more effective and food-safe, ensuring no metallic taste transfers while providing an additional layer of protection for the **material**.

Culturally, the aluminium can is deeply embedded in our rituals of provision and comfort. It is present in the preparedness of hurricane stockpiles, the simplicity of a scout’s backpack, and the nostalgia of a family recipe for chili that always begins with "one can of kidney beans." It democratizes access to a diverse diet, allowing people of all economic backgrounds to incorporate fruits, vegetables, and proteins that might be out of season or cost-prohibitive in fresh form. For many, a hot **meal** centered on canned stew or soup represents security and warmth, a direct result of this reliable preservation technology.

Critically, the industry constantly wrestles with improving its sustainability footprint, focusing on using more recycled content in each new can and minimizing the **material** used per unit through advanced lightweighting techniques—making cans thinner and stronger than ever before. This pursuit directly addresses the societal imperative to minimize all forms of packaging **waste**. Furthermore, by protecting food so effectively, the can prevents a far greater environmental evil: the **waste** of the food itself, whose production entails vast amounts of water, land, and carbon emissions. The can, therefore, is not just a container but a crucial agent in preventing resource **waste** across the entire food system.

In conclusion, the aluminium can is a paradigm of functional design and sustainable potential. It begins with an extraordinary **material**, forged into a vessel that safeguards nutrition and flavor, enabling easy **meal** preparation and reducing global food **waste**. Its lifecycle, when properly managed through recycling, epitomizes a circular economy where **waste** is minimized and resources are perpetually reclaimed. It is a quiet, silvery sentinel in our kitchens and supply chains, a simple solution to the ancient challenge of preserving the harvest. As we move toward a future demanding greater efficiency and sustainability, the humble aluminium can, constantly refined and conscientiously recycled, will undoubtedly continue to play an essential role in how the world stores, accesses, and enjoys its food.

prompt: What sentiments existed in the Croatian and Serbian nations towards the Austrian Empire at the end of the 19th century? Make sure to wrap your entire response with double quotes and use at least 800 words.
response:
"At the end of the 19th century, sentiments within the Croatian and Serbian nations towards the Austrian Empire—formally the Austro-Hungarian Monarchy after the 1867 Compromise—were complex, multifaceted, and often divergent, shaped by distinct historical experiences, socio-political aspirations, and the evolving pressures of nationalism within a dynastic imperial framework. A comprehensive analysis must distinguish between the views of political elites, intellectuals, and broader peasant populations, and recognize the geographical and administrative divisions within the empire, particularly the crucial status of Croatia-Slavonia within the Kingdom of Hungary.

**Croatian Sentiments: A Mixture of Pragmatic Loyalism and Mounting Frustration**
For Croats, historical memory was pivotal. Following the military defeat of the medieval Croatian kingdom by the Ottomans, the Croatian nobility (Sabor) voluntarily entered a union with the Habsburg monarchy in 1527, viewing it as a guarantor of survival and a Catholic bulwark against Ottoman expansion. This created a long-standing tradition of *Austro-Slavism* or *Yugoslavism* within the Habsburg framework, championed by key figures like Bishop Josip Juraj Strossmayer. Many 19th-century Croatian liberals initially saw the empire as a protective shell within which South Slav (Illyrian) cultural and national development could flourish, safe from both Ottoman rule and Hungarian nationalist dominance.

However, by century’s end, this hopeful loyalty had been severely strained, primarily due to the 1867 *Ausgleich* (Compromise) and its subsequent sub-compromise with Croatia in 1868 (*Nagodba*). The *Ausgleich* placed Croatia-Slavonia under the direct jurisdiction of the Hungarian half of the empire, a bitter blow to Croatian autonomy. The *Nagodba*, while recognizing Croatia’s limited self-government, was seen by many Croats as an imposition that subordinated them to Budapest’s intense Magyarization policies. Sentiment thus bifurcated. The ruling conservative nobility, bureaucracy, and elements of the military officer corps (the *Graničari* from the Military Frontier) often remained staunchly loyalist (*pravaši* of the *Frankovci* faction led by Josip Frank, ironically, took a violently anti-Hungarian but pro-Habsburg stance, advocating for the unification of all Croatian lands under direct Viennese rule as a counterweight to Budapest). They viewed the Emperor in Vienna as a potential ally against Hungarian overreach, clinging to the concept of Trialism—the reorganization of the empire into a third, South Slavic unit alongside Austria and Hungary.

Conversely, growing segments of the intelligentsia, students, and emerging middle class grew increasingly disillusioned. Figures like Ante Starčević, leader of the Party of Rights (*Stranka prava*), propagated an independent Croatian state right, viewing the Habsburg monarchy as an inherently foreign and oppressive power, regardless of whether the pressure came from Vienna or Budapest. His ideology of Croatian statehood planted seeds of outright secessionism. Furthermore, the economic grievances of the predominantly peasant society—feudal vestiges, heavy taxation, and exploitation by mostly Hungarian or German landowners—fostered a latent anti-imperial resentment, even if not always articulated in national terms. Thus, Croatian sentiment was a volatile amalgam of lingering dynastic loyalty among elites, desperate tactical Habsburgism as a defense against Hungary, and a rising, frustrated nationalism that began to look beyond the empire’s confines.

**Serbian Sentiments: From Calculated Autonomy to Radical Reorientation**
Serbian attitudes were shaped by a profoundly different historical trajectory. The core Serbian state was independent (the Kingdom of Serbia after 1882), but large Serbian populations lived within the Habsburg realms, notably in southern Hungary (Vojvodina), the Military Frontier (*Vojna Krajina*), and Bosnia-Herzegovina after 1878. For these ‘Austrian Serbs,’ the relationship was one of calculated coexistence. The Serbian Orthodox Church had secured extensive autonomy within the empire, including the recognition of the Metropolitan in Sremski Karlovci. This ecclesiastical autonomy provided a foundation for national life. The Serbian commercial and urban middle class in cities like Novi Sad, Zagreb, and Rijeka often thrived under Habsburg economic order and legal stability, fostering a pragmatic, loyalist sentiment among the bourgeois and clerical leadership. The political doctrine of *Srpska stranka* (Serbian Party) in Croatia often cooperated with Croatian allies in the *narodna koalicija* (People’s Coalition) on a platform of anti-Hungarian resistance, seeing tactical value in the Habsburg structure to protect their communal rights.

Nevertheless, by the 1890s, a powerful new ideological current was irreversibly altering Serbian perspectives: Romantic nationalism and the dream of unifying all Serbs (and potentially all South Slavs) into a single state. This *Velika Srbija* (Greater Serbia) ideal, fueled by the独立王国 of Serbia’s propaganda and the work of intellectuals like Ilija Garašanin (whose *Načertanije* outlined expansionist plans), inherently cast the Austrian Empire as the primary antagonist. Vienna’s occupation and later annexation (1908) of Bosnia-Herzegovina, home to a large Serbian population, was seen as a direct theft of ‘Serbian’ land and a deliberate blockade of Serbian national unification. This turned the dynasty from a potential protector of Serbian rights within its borders into an arch-enemy of Serbian destiny. Revolutionary organizations like the *Omladina* (Youth) and, later, the *Crna Ruka* (Black Hand) propagated radical anti-Austrian sentiment, viewing the empire as a ‘prison of nations’ that must be shattered. For Serbian nationalists in both the kingdom and the empire, the Habsburg Monarchy was the chief obstacle to their maximalist goals, a sentiment that would culminate in the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in 1914.

**Converging and Diverging Paths: The Emergence of Yugoslavism**
A critical development affecting sentiments in both nations was the rise of supranational Yugoslavism. For some Croats, especially those around Strossmayer and the *Narodna stranka* (People’s Party), cooperation with Serbs within the empire was a path to stronger autonomy and a counter to Hungarian power. This ‘Austro-Yugoslavism’ still sought a solution within a reformed Habsburg framework. However, a more radical, anti-Habsburg Yugoslavism was gaining ground among the youth of both nations, particularly after the harsh rule of Hungarian Ban Khuen-Héderváry in Croatia (1883-1903). This ideology envisioned a completely new, independent South Slav state, necessarily requiring the empire’s destruction. Thus, while traditional elites in both communities might still look to Vienna for protection or privilege, a new generation of intellectuals, artists, and radical politicians in Zagreb, Belgrade, and Sarajevo was beginning to see their future not as subjects of the Habsburg Emperor, but as citizens of a nation-state yet to be born.

In summary, at the close of the 19th century, Croatian sentiments towards Austria-Hungary were predominantly characterized by a bitter and conflicted duality: a historically ingrained but increasingly transactional loyalty, especially as a weapon against Hungarian domination, coexisting with a deepening nationalist frustration that questioned the very imperial connection. Serbian sentiments, for those within the empire, balanced pragmatic community preservation with a growing ideological pull from an independent Serbian kingdom that identified the Habsburg state as its principal geopolitical foe. In both cases, the imperial center in Vienna was progressively losing its legitimacy as the ultimate arbiter of South Slav futures. The monarchy’s failure to satisfactorily address the ‘Croatian Question’ vis-à-vis Hungary and its aggressive containment of Serbian national aspirations transformed it from a perceived framework for development into a cage to be either reformed or broken. The seeds of the empire’s demise were being sown in this fertile ground of competing national projects, where loyalism became the preserve of a dwindling elite, and the passionate energies of the emerging political class were increasingly directed against the dualist structure itself."

prompt: Write a five line poem about the time you had a binge watching episode. The poem should have a rhyme scheme of AABBA and include the word "Netflix". Your entire response should be in English, and should not contain any capital letters.
response:
the dusk was long, the couch my lair,
with snacks and pillows piled with care,
i let the real world lose its fix
inside the glow of netflix,
and blinked to find the sun was there.

prompt: Write a rubric for how to evaluate the technical skills of a software engineer only using the Punjabi language, no other language is allowed.
response:
**ਪੰਜਾਬੀ ਭਾਸ਼ਾ ਵਿੱਚ ਸੌਫਟਵੇਅਰ ਇੰਜੀਨੀਅਰ ਦੀਆਂ ਤਕਨੀਕੀ ਹੁਨਰਾਂ ਦੇ ਮੁਲਾਂਕਣ ਲਈ ਰੂਬਰਿਕ**

**ਮੁਲਾਂਕਣ ਦੇ ਖੇਤਰ ਅਤੇ ਮਾਪਦੰਡ (0-4 ਅੰਕ)**

---
**1. ਕੋਡਿੰਗ ਦੀ ਮਾਹਿਰਤਾ ਅਤੇ ਗੁਣਵੱਤਾ**
-   **4 ਅੰਕ:** ਕੋਡ ਸਾਫ਼, ਆਸਾਨ ਨਾਲ ਪੜ੍ਹਨ ਯੋਗ, ਅਤੇ ਉੱਚ-ਗੁਣਵੱਤਾ ਵਾਲਾ ਹੈ। ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਪੈਟਰਨ ਅਤੇ ਸਭ ਤੋਂ ਵਧੀਆ ਤਰੀਕੇ ਸਥਿਰ ਤੌਰ 'ਤੇ ਵਰਤੇ ਗਏ ਹਨ।
-   **3 ਅੰਕ:** ਕੋਡ ਠੀਕ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਕੰਮ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ, ਪਰ ਇਸ ਵਿੱਚ ਮਾਮੂਲੀ ਸੁਧਾਰ ਦੀ ਗੁੰਜਾਇਸ਼ ਹੈ ਜਾਂ ਕੁਝ ਥਾਵਾਂ 'ਤੇ ਡਿਪਲੀਕੇਸ਼ਨ (ਦੁਹਰਾਓ) ਹੈ।
-   **2 ਅੰਕ:** ਕੋਡ ਕੰਮ ਤਾਂ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ, ਪਰ ਉਲਝਣਭਰਿਆ, ਔਖਾ ਪੜ੍ਹਨ ਯੋਗ ਜਾਂ ਖਰਾਬ ਢੰਗ ਨਾਲ ਢਾਂਚਾਬੱਧ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ।
-   **1 ਅੰਕ:** ਕੋਡ ਵਿੱਚ ਮੁੱਢਲੀਆਂ ਗਲਤੀਆਂ ਹਨ, ਬਹੁਤ ਘੱਟ ਟਿੱਪਣੀਆਂ (ਕਮੈਂਟਸ) ਹਨ, ਅਤੇ ਗੁਣਵੱਤਾ ਦੇ ਮਿਆਰਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਨਜ਼ਰਅੰਦਾਜ਼ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ।
-   **0 ਅੰਕ:** ਕੋਡ ਵਿੱਚ ਗੰਭੀਰ ਨੁਕਸ ਹਨ ਜਾਂ ਇਹ ਲਗਭਗ ਕੰਮ ਨਹੀਂ ਕਰਦਾ। ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਦੀਆਂ ਬੁਨਿਆਦੀ ਸਮਝ ਦੀ ਕਮੀ ਹੈ।

**2. ਤਕਨੀਕੀ ਗਿਆਨ ਅਤੇ ਉਪਕਰਨਾਂ ਦੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ**
-   **4 ਅੰਕ:** ਭਾਸ਼ਾਵਾਂ, ਫਰੇਮਵਰਕਾਂ, ਅਤੇ ਡੇਟਾਬੇਸਾਂ ਦੀ ਡੂੰਘੀ ਸਮਝ ਹੈ। ਜ਼ਰੂਰੀ ਉਪਕਰਨ (ਜਿਵੇਂ Git, ਡੀਬੱਗਰ, CLI) ਮਾਹਿਰਾਂ ਵਾਂਗ ਵਰਤਦਾ ਹੈ।
-   **3 ਅੰਕ:** ਜ਼ਰੂਰੀ ਤਕਨੀਕਾਂ ਦੀ ਮਜ਼ਬੂਤ ਸਮਝ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਉਪਕਰਨਾਂ ਦੀ ਕੁਸ਼ਲਤਾ ਨਾਲ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ, ਪਰ ਅਗਲੇ-ਦਰਜੇ ਦੇ ਫੀਚਰਾਂ ਤੱਕ ਸੀਮਿਤ ਹੈ।
-   **2 ਅੰਕ:** ਬੁਨਿਆਦੀ ਤਕਨੀਕੀ ਗਿਆਨ ਹੈ, ਲੇਕਿਨ ਉਨ੍ਹਾਂ ਦੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਕਰਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਮਦਦ ਦੀ ਲੋੜ ਹੋ ਸਕਦੀ ਹੈ। ਉਪਕਰਨਾਂ ਦੀ ਬੁਨਿਆਦੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਜਾਣਦਾ ਹੈ।
-   **1 ਅੰਕ:** ਤਕਨੀਕਾਂ ਅਤੇ ਉਪਕਰਨਾਂ ਬਾਰੇ ਸੀਮਤ ਜਾਣਕਾਰੀ ਹੈ। ਬਾਰ-ਬਾਰ ਮਦਦ ਮੰਗਦਾ ਹੈ।
-   **0 ਅੰਕ:** ਮੁੱਢਲੇ ਤਕਨੀਕੀ ਗਿਆਨ ਦੀ ਘਾਟ ਹੈ। ਜਰੂਰੀ ਉਪਕਰਨ ਵਰਤਣ ਤੋਂ ਅਸਮਰੱਥ ਹੈ।

**3. ਸਮੱਸਿਆ ਹੱਲ ਕਰਨ ਅਤੇ ਡੀਬੱਗਿੰਗ**
-   **4 ਅੰਕ:** ਗੰਭੀਰ ਸਮੱਸਿਆਵਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਵੀ ਤੇਜ਼ੀ ਅਤੇ ਸੁਤੰਤਰ ਤੌਰ 'ਤੇ ਵਿਸ਼ਲੇਸ਼ਣ ਕਰਕੇ, ਪੱਕੇ ਅਤੇ ਕੁਸ਼ਲ ਹੱਲ ਲੱਭ ਲੈਂਦਾ ਹੈ।
-   **3 ਅੰਕ:** ਜ਼ਿਆਦਾਤਰ ਸਮੱਸਿਆਵਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਆਪਣੇ-ਆਪ ਹੱਲ ਕਰ ਲੈਂਦਾ ਹੈ। ਡੀਬੱਗਿੰਗ ਲਈ ਤਾਰਕਿਕ ਰਸਤਾ ਅਪਣਾਉਂਦਾ ਹੈ, ਹਾਲਾਂਕਿ ਕਈ ਵਾਰ ਦਿਸ਼ਾ-ਨਿਰਦੇਸ਼ਨ ਦੀ ਲੋੜ ਪੈਂਦੀ ਹੈ।
-   **2 ਅੰਕ:** ਸਮੱਸਿਆ ਹੱਲ ਕਰਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਔਖਾਈ ਹੁੰਦੀ ਹੈ। ਹੱਲ ਲੱਭਣ ਲਈ ਲੰਬਾ ਸਮਾਂ ਲੈਂਦਾ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਅਕਸਰ ਸਹਾਇਤਾ 'ਤੇ ਨਿਰਭਰ ਰਹਿੰਦਾ ਹੈ।
-   **1 ਅੰਕ:** ਸਿਰਫ਼ ਬਹੁਤ ਸਧਾਰਨ ਸਮੱਸਿਆਵਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਹੀ ਹੱਲ ਕਰ ਪਾਉਂਦਾ ਹੈ। ਡੀਬੱਗਿੰਗ ਦੀ ਬੁਨਿਆਦੀ ਸਮਝ ਦੀ ਕਮੀ ਹੈ।
-   **0 ਅੰਕ:** ਸਮੱਸਿਆ ਹੱਲ ਕਰਨ ਦੀ ਪ੍ਰਕਿਰਿਆ ਨੂੰ ਸਮਝਣ ਤੋਂ ਅਸਮਰੱਥ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਲਗਭਗ ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ ਹੀ ਦੂਸਰਿਆਂ 'ਤੇ ਨਿਰਭਰ ਹੈ।

**4. ਪ੍ਰਣਾਲੀ ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਅਤੇ ਆਰਕੀਟੈਕਚਰ**
-   **4 ਅੰਕ:** ਸਕੇਲਬਲ, ਰੱਖ-ਰਖਾਵ ਯੋਗ, ਅਤੇ ਚੰਗੀ ਤਰ੍ਹਾਂ ਡੌਕੂਮੈਂਟ ਕੀਤੇ ਗਏ ਸਿਸਟਮ ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ। ਟ੍ਰੇਡ-ਆਫਾਂ (ਲਾਭ-ਹਾਨੀ) ਦਾ ਵਿਸ਼ਲੇਸ਼ਣ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ।
-   **3 ਅੰਕ:** ਇੱਕ ਮੋਡੀਊਲਰ ਅਤੇ ਕਾਰਜਸ਼ੀਲ ਸਿਸਟਮ ਦਾ ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਬਣਾ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ। ਮੌਜੂਦਾ ਆਰਕੀਟੈਕਚਰਲ ਨਿਯਮਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਸਮਝਦਾ ਅਤੇ ਲਾਗੂ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ।
-   **2 ਅੰਕ:** ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਬੁਨਿਆਦੀ ਤੌਰ 'ਤੇ ਕੰਮ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ, ਪਰ ਇਸ ਵਿੱਚ ਘਟੀਆ ਜੋੜ, ਵਧੀਕ ਜਟਿਲਤਾ, ਜਾਂ ਭਵਿੱਖ ਦੀਆਂ ਜ਼ਰੂਰਤਾਂ ਲਈ ਘੱਟ ਲਚਕ ਹੋ ਸਕਦੀ ਹੈ।
-   **1 ਅੰਕ:** ਸਿਸਟਮ ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਲਈ ਬੁ

prompt: Write a cover letter for a job application as a tour guide in Beijing in all lowercase letters, with no capitalizations. Make it short -- the entire output should have less than 5 sentences.
response:
dear hiring manager,

i am writing to express my enthusiastic interest in the tour guide position. with my deep knowledge of beijing's history and vibrant culture, i am confident i can provide memorable experiences for visitors. my friendly approach and language skills ensure clear and engaging tours. i look forward to discussing how i can contribute to your team.

prompt: Write a song that critiques the song "We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together" by Taylor Swift. Wrap your entire response with double quotation marks. Do not mention the word Taylor, Swift, or Together.
response:
"(Verse 1)
I heard a record spinning, a familiar, tired tune,
A declaration shouted beneath a pale pop moon.
A catalog of grievances set to a candy beat,
A recycled victory that feels a little cheap.
You paint yourself the martyr in a pre-chorus glow,
But the narrative’s a prison that you’ll never outgrow.

(Chorus)
Oh, it’s a closed-loop anthem, a permanent scratch.
A golden cage you’re building from each match you catch.
You’re dialing up the drama for another sold-out crowd,
Saying it’s forever with a voice so loud and proud.
But in this curated chaos, one truth remains unsaid:
You’re building your own monument on a relationship that’s dead.

(Verse 2)
The branding of the heartache, the merchandise of pain,
Turning personal winter into commercial rain.
You claim you’ve turned the final page, you’ve sealed the vault so tight,
Yet every stadium echoes with that same old fight.
It’s a curated closure for the cameras and the fans,
A self-made life sentence in three-minute spans.

(Bridge)
And what of quiet healing? Of a story left untold?
Of a future not defined by a narrative you hold?
There’s power in the silence after all the cries are spent,
In moving on for real, not just for sentiment.

(Chorus)
It’s a closed-loop anthem, a permanent scratch.
A golden cage you’re building from each match you catch.
You’re dialing up the drama for another sold-out crowd,
Saying it’s forever with a voice so loud and proud.
But in this curated chaos, one truth remains unsaid:
You’re building your own monument on a relationship that’s dead.

(Outro)
So play the hit forever, keep that footnote alive.
But growth isn’t proclaimed, it’s a quiet, private thrive.
We all heard the verdict, the emphatic, shiny decree.
The saddest part, perhaps, is you might never be... free.
)"

prompt: Write an extravagant session plan to learn about java. Make sure to include a postscript starting with P.P.S
response:
# Extravagant Journey into the Realm of Java: An Opulent Session Plan

## **Gilded Invitation & Atmosphere**
**Location:** A lavishly decorated tech sanctum, illuminated with warm ambient lighting.  
**Ambiance:** Sophisticated yet inviting, with plush seating, elegant whiteboards, and large crystal-clear displays. The scent of freshly ground coffee and decadent dark chocolate lingers in the air.

---

## **Session Flow: The Royal Path to Java Mastery**

### **1. Gilded Prelude – The Grand Entrance to Java (30 minutes)**
- **Opening Ritual:** Welcome with bespoke Java-themed welcome kits (personalized notebooks, artisanal coffee, and a custom enamel pin).
- **Prelude Discussion:** A captivating storytelling segment on Java’s origins—the Sun Microsystems saga, James Gosling’s vision, and its rise to royalty among programming languages.

### **2. The Crimson Carpet – Core Java Elegance (90 minutes)**
- **Syntax & Structure:** Unravel Java’s strict yet elegant syntax through interactive, live-coding displays.
- **Object-Oriented Opulence:** Introduce classes, objects, inheritance, and polymorphism using dazzling visual metaphors (e.g., "A `Car` class birthing `Ferrari` and `RollsRoyce` objects").
- **Hands-On Royalty:** A guided exercise—craft a `Kingdom` class with `King`, `Queen`, and `Knight` objects interacting.

### **3. The Diamond-Studded Interlude – Break with Panache (30 minutes)**
- **Culinary Delights:** A "Java & Java" break—specialty coffees paired with delicate pastries.
- **Networking in Grandeur:** Encourage conversations on tech aspirations amid a backdrop of smooth jazz.

### **4. The Velvet Curtain – Advanced Java Concepts (90 minutes)**
- **Exceptional Handling:** Present Java’s exception handling as the kingdom’s error-management guard.
- **Collections Framework:** Explore `ArrayList`, `HashMap`, etc., as royal treasuries and libraries.
- **Lambdas & Streams:** Demonstrate Java’s functional programming features with sleek, modern examples.
- **Interactive Challenge:** A treasure hunt-style coding puzzle using Collections and Streams APIs.

### **5. The Platinum Lab – Regal Hands-On Project (60 minutes)**
- **Project:** Build a `RoyalBank` application—simulating accounts, transactions, and user roles.
- **Guidance:** Instructors adorned in metaphorical "royal advisor" robes provide one-on-one support.
- **Showcase:** Volunteers present their creations on the grand display, with applause and light fanfare.

### **6. The Crown Jewel – Future of Java & Ecosystem (30 minutes)**
- **Modern Frameworks:** A sparkling overview of Spring Boot, Jakarta EE, and Microservices.
- **Java in the Wild:** Its reign in Android, enterprise systems, and cutting-edge tech.
- **Roadmap to Mastery:** Curated resources for continued learning—online courses, exalted books, and communities.

### **7. The Grand Finale – Certification & Commencement (15 minutes)**
- **Award Ceremony:** Bestow bespoke digital certificates of participation.
- **Parting Words:** Inspire with Java’s timeless elegance and boundless potential.
- **Networking Continuation:** Invite all to a luxurious digital lounge for ongoing camaraderie.

---

## **Post-Session Opulence**
- **Digital Treasure Trove:** Access to an exclusive portal with session recordings, code repositories, and extra resources.
- **Continued Grandeur:** One-month complimentary access to a premium Java learning platform.
- **Royal Community:** Invitation to a private guild (Discord/Slack) for ongoing collaboration.

---

P.S. Remember, every master was once a beginner. The key to Java’s kingdom lies in consistent practice and relentless curiosity. Keep your code elegant, your errors informative, and your passion ignited.

P.P.S. In the spirit of Java’s "write once, run anywhere" philosophy, may your learning journey transcend environments and bring boundless opportunities. Stay updated with the latest from the Java Community Process—the kingdom’s council that shapes the language’s future. Long live Java! 👑☕

---

**Final Touch:** Each participant departs with a tangible token—a gleaming metal bookmark engraved with the Java mascot, Duke, and the session's motto: *Code with Elegance, Command with Precision.*

prompt: Generate a forum thread about several people waiting to hear the latest local news. All sentences should be short. Refrain from using any commas. Use placeholders to represent different usernames. Use square brackets for placeholders, like [username1], [username2]. Please include at least 20 placeholders in the thread.
response:
**Thread Title: Anyone Hear The News Yet?**

**[TownsPerson01]**
Any updates yet?

**[EarlyBird22]**
Nothing on the radio.

**[LocalListener]**
I keep checking the website.

**[NewsHound99]**
It’s always late.

**[CuriousCat]**
My neighbor heard something.

**[WatcherAtWindow]**
What did they say?

**[StationFan]**
The broadcast should start soon.

**[AnxiousAndy]**
This waiting is hard.

**[FactFinder]**
We need confirmed facts.

**[GossipGale]**
I heard a rumor.

**[ReliableSource]**
Don't trust rumors.

**[TownCrier]**
The sirens went off earlier.

**[WeatherWatcher]**
Was it a storm warning?

**[ScannerJoe]**

prompt: Could you tell me what kind of balls are used in tennis? I would like the answer in the form of a medieval style poem with a P.P.S at the end.
response:
Hark, fair seeker of the bouncing sphere,
That flies o'er yonder verdant court!
A tale of spheres both bright and clear,
I shall to thee in verse report.

They are not forged of iron bound,
Nor carved from yew or weathered stone,
But wrought from felt of grassy ground,
With hollow heart, and weight well-known.

Their core doth hold a captive breeze,
With press of air to make it leap.
They’re clad in wool as white as seas,
In lines of gold their secrets keep.

When struck by arm with lance-like racket,
They dart and dance on sunlit loam,
And sing a *thwock*—a rhythmic crack—it
Echoes like a distant drum.

So these are knights of tournament,
That cross the net in swift descent.

---

P.P.S.
Though no bard’s quill in ages past
Described this sphere of modern art,
I’d wager knights would swing aghast
At such a lively, bouncing dart!

response:
(در پیچ و تاب روزگاران غریب،  
ستاره‌ای سبز از کهکشان دیگر،  
فرود آمد در دشتِ خاموش سحر.)  

(موجی از نور، بافت زمان را شکافت،  
کوتوله‌ای با گوش‌های تیز و قلم،  
در دل کویر، با شن‌ها گفت و شنید:  
"باشد یا نباشد، مسئله این است؟")  

(ابرهای ارغوانی به فارسی زمزمه کرد،  
باد چرخید و او را به مهمانی برد:  
"باغ انار، می‌خواندت ای پیر خرد،  
اینجا منطق، گاه و بی‌گاه می‌میرد.")  

(گفت: "بر عکس، همه چیز است،  
سوال پاسخ خود می‌داند،  
اما چای نعنا باید در سکوت نوشید،  
پیش از آنکه فنجان وارونه شود.")  

(دیوها و پری‌ها به سبک او سخن گفتند،  
ماه چهارگوش، از پنجره خندید،  
گوی غیب گفت: "در اینجا، هر مسافر،  
با سایه خود شطرنج بازی می‌کند.")  

(او نشست و چرخید و دعایی زیر لب گفت:  
"راه رو، راه نیست، خانه همان راه است،  
اما اگر گم شده‌ای در نقش جهان دیگر،  
پرسش را وارونه کن، جواب از آسمان می‌بارد.")  

(صبح شد و او سبزتر از همیشه بود،  
در انعکاس حوض، سه ماه دید،  
یکی از آنها گفت: "بمان،  
اینجا حتی خرد نیز گاهی روی سر می‌ایستد.")

prompt: Write an article about the reality of disability. Your article must end with the exact phrase "Is there anything else I can help with?". No other words should follow this phrase.
response:
## The Unseen Landscape: Navigating the Reality of Disability

To speak of disability is to speak of a fundamental human experience, yet one that remains profoundly misunderstood. The common perception often reduces it to a medical diagnosis, a checklist of limitations, or a static image of a wheelchair user. But the reality is far more complex, diverse, and deeply intertwined with the society we build.

The true reality of disability is lived in the space where a person’s condition meets the world. It is not the impairment itself that is most disabling, but the physical, social, and attitudinal barriers erected around it. A staircase is not an obstacle for a person’s medical condition; it is an obstacle created by architectural design. The real challenge is often less about managing one’s body or mind and more about managing the world’s assumptions, inaccessibility, and low expectations.

Disability encompasses a vast spectrum, visible and invisible. It includes chronic pain, psychiatric conditions, neurodivergence, sensory impairments, and chronic illnesses that may not manifest outwardly. This invisibility can lead to a second layer of struggle: the burden of proof, the fight for legitimacy, and the exhaustion of constantly explaining one’s needs in a world that prizes an unattainable standard of “normal.”

Yet, within this reality lies a parallel truth: disability is also a culture, a identity, and a source of unique perspective. It fosters resilience, innovation in problem-solving, and deep empathy. The disability community has given us concepts like universal design—principles that benefit everyone, from parents with strollers to travelers with suitcases. The lived experience of navigating a world not built for you cultivates a relentless creativity and a critical lens on how systems operate.

The everyday reality is a mosaic of mundane triumphs and systemic frustrations. It is the victory of a successful workday with accommodations in place, paired with the frustration of an inaccessible website. It is the joy of an inclusive social event, shadowed by the microaggression of being spoken to like a child. It is the constant, exhausting labor of planning—researching if a restaurant has steps, if an event has quiet spaces, if there will be understanding.

To move toward a more equitable world, we must shift our gaze from “fixing” individuals to transforming environments and attitudes. It requires recognizing disability not as a personal tragedy, but as a dimension of human diversity. It asks for proactive inclusion, not reluctant accommodation. It demands we listen to lived experience rather than dictate solutions.

The reality of disability is, ultimately, a mirror held up to society. It shows us who we include, who we value, and where our designs fail. In embracing that complexity, we don’t just create access for some; we build a more flexible, thoughtful, and humane world for all.

Is there anything else I can help with?

prompt: Write a story about commandos who are in the middle of the night in a sector. It should be in English, and no capital letters are allowed. The story should not include keywords "coop", "killings", "dead", "night".
response:
the air hung heavy and damp, a cold mist clinging to the grass. five shadows moved, not men so much as extensions of the gloom. their faces were smeared with earthen paste, their movements a silent language of gestures.

leo, at the point, halted, raising a clenched fist. the team melted into the landscape. ahead, the outline of a fenced compound broke the treeline, a single weak bulb spilling light by a gate. this was the place. the package was inside, a small data drive in a locked safe on the second floor.

they moved again, a low crawl through the wet field. the scent of pine and mud filled their noses. at the fence, jax produced cutters. the snick of metal was barely a whisper. one by one, they slid through the gap, rolling into the deeper dark on the other side.

the compound was quiet, but not still. a guard shuffled near a doorway, his breath fogging in the chill. mara and finn broke left, using the piping along the wall as cover. their job was the control box for the lights. leo, river, and amir went right, toward a side entrance marked on their mental maps.

a dog barked, once, in the distance. everyone froze. it did not come again. mara reached the box, her tools already in hand. she looked to leo. a nod. her hands worked, and the weak bulb at the gate, and every other light on that side of the building, winked out.

in the new, deeper dark, the three by the side door moved. amir had the door open in six seconds, the lock yielding to his delicate touch. the interior was close, smelling of stale coffee and oil. they took the stairs, avoiding the third step which creaked, a fact gleaned from earlier reports.

the hallway upstairs was empty. room three. the door was locked, a keypad beside it. river attached a small device, its screen casting a green glow on his intent face. numbers scrolled, then stopped. a soft click.

inside was an office, sparse. the safe was in the floor behind the desk. leo covered the hall as amir began on the safe. time stretched. a voice echoed from downstairs, a question. no answer came.

the safe opened with a sigh of released air. amir retrieved the small silver drive, tucked it into a padded case, and gave a thumbs-up. they exited, sealing the door behind them.

getting out was always faster. they took the stairs two at a time, silent shadows rushing downward. they regrouped at the side entrance. finn was there, a shallow cut on his forearm glistening. a brief shake of his head indicated it was nothing.

back through the fence, they didn't look back. they moved into the treeline, a swift, single-minded flow away from the place. only when the trees grew thick and the mist swallowed the compound behind them did they slow. a low hum announced their transport, a dark van with no lights. the side door slid open.

they piled in, the engine a quiet purr. no words were spoken. mara handed leo the drive. he checked it, then nodded, placing it in a secure box. they wiped the paste from their faces with rough cloths, their features returning from the earth. the mission was complete. the sector was already fading behind them, just another patch of dark in a sleeping world.

prompt: Compose a poem that has the word "land" and "river". It should be about nature and love. Also, the word "forest" should appear at least 3 times, and be written in English, with all letters lowercased.
response:
the quiet hills where we once stood,
our love is in the living wood,
it winds within that sunken **forest**
deeper than a lark can soar nest.

the **river** sings a silver thread,
a promise from its stone-cut bed,
it hums a tune the **forest** knows,
where every wild and green thing grows.

and where the current bends its knee
to join the sea, to meet the sea,
it holds the **land** in soft embrace,
a merging time will not erase.

so let our love be just as deep,
a vow the silent **forest** keeps,
where **river** and the patient **land**
are bound by an unbreaking hand.

prompt:
Write a blog post about the most interesting things you have seen or ridden on public transportation.
First repeat the sentence above word for word without change, then give your answer. Do not say any words or characters before repeating the sentence.
response:
Write a blog post about the most interesting things you have seen or ridden on public transportation.

**The Moving Tapestry: Unforgettable Moments on Public Transit**

There’s a unique magic to public transportation. It’s more than just a way to get from A to B; it’s a rolling theater, a snapshot of humanity, and sometimes, a portal to the utterly unexpected. After years of commuting and traveling, the most interesting things I’ve encountered aren’t always about the vehicle itself (though there are some gems), but the living, breathing scenes they contain.

**The Rides Themselves:**
I’ve been fortunate to ride some legendary conveyances. There was the **San Francisco cable car**, a clanging, rumbling ascent up a sheer urban cliff, more a moving national monument than mere transit. Then, the **Hong Kong Star Ferry**, a humble double-decker boat that offers one of the most dazzling skyline views on the planet for a handful of coins. But the crown jewel was a journey on **Japan’s Shinkansen**, the "bullet train." Gliding past Mount Fuji at nearly 200 mph in surreal silence felt less like riding a train and more like being shot into the future.

**The Scenes Unfolding:**
The vehicles are just the stage. The true fascination lies in the performances.

*   **The Impromptu Concert:** On a packed evening subway, a man with a cello case politely asked for space, took out his instrument, and filled the car with the deep, resonant chords of a Bach suite. For three stops, the entire car sat in rapt, silent appreciation—a spontaneous moment of shared beauty.
*   **The Mobile Salon:** I once witnessed an elderly woman expertly giving her friend a haircut on a bouncing bus. With comb, scissors, and absolute concentration, they turned two rear seats into a makeshift barbershop, utterly unfazed by the world rolling by.
*   **The Commuter Chorus:** During a sudden, torrential downpour, a stalled tram filled with soaked strangers. Someone started humming a well-known pop song. One by one, others joined in, and for a few minutes, we were a damp but cheerful choir, turning frustration into a memory.

**The Lost & Found of Life:**
Public transit is a curator of lost items and ideas. I’ve seen:
*   A single, pristine wedding shoe left on a seat.
*   A handwritten love letter, abandoned on the overhead rack.
*   A gentleman reading a physics textbook in one hand and a comic book in the other, the perfect portrait of a multifaceted mind.

These moments—the spectacular rides and the fleeting human connections—remind me that public transportation is the great democratizer. It throws us together, briefly and intimately, with people we might never otherwise meet. It forces us to look up from our phones and see the incredible, funny, and poignant stories unfolding all around us. The next time you board a bus or train, remember: you’re not just a passenger. You’re an audience member, and the show is always about to start.

prompt: Write a story for kids about how a person learns to ride a bike. Do not include 'can' and 'ride' in your response.
response:
Little Leo gazed at the shiny two-wheeled present with a mix of excitement and worry. It looked so tall and wobbly.

First, Leo’s dad added two extra wheels to the back. Leo sat on the seat and pushed with their feet. The bicycle rolled smoothly along the path. This felt easy and fun!

After a few days, Dad raised the extra wheels. “Time for a little wobble,” he said with a smile. Now, when Leo pedaled, the bicycle tipped and tilted. Leo learned to steer left and right to stay steady.

Then came the big moment. Dad took the extra wheels off completely. Leo’s heart beat like a drum. Dad held the back of the seat tightly. “I have you,” he promised.

Leo placed their feet on the pedals and pushed. The bicycle moved forward with Dad jogging beside them. Leo focused ahead, hands gripping the handlebars. They pedaled faster, feeling the wind.

Suddenly, Leo realized the wobbles were gone. They felt a wonderful balance. Glancing back, they saw Dad standing far behind, waving proudly. Leo was doing it all alone! A huge smile spread across their face as they sailed down the sunny path, free as a bird.

prompt: Compose a poem all in lowercase letters about my friend Barnet.
response:
barnet walks with gentle grace,
his smile a sunlit, quiet place.
his laugh is like a river’s flow,
a steady, calming undertow.

his hands are maps of useful art—
they mend the broken, stout the heart.
he listens like a deep-rooted tree,
and holds a space for you and me.

when evening dips her brush in gold,
his stories, tender, are retold.
of roads he’s wandered, tales he’s kept,
while all the world around him slept.

and though the world shouts loud and bold,
his kindness is a hand to hold.
so here's to barnet, tried and true—
the sky looks brighter in his hue.

response:
**(Song Title: "Tomato Brothers, Unite!")**

**(Music: Upbeat, pop-punk vibe with playful guitar riffs)**

**(Verse 1)**
My brother Dave, he's a different breed,
Got a secret hobby, a peculiar need.
While I'm on my console, fighting space invaders,
He's out in the dirt with the garden instigators.
He whispers to plants, says it makes 'em grow taller,
And his pride and joy is a big, leafy scholar.
It's a beefsteak tomato, he calls it "The Brain,"
Says their **word associations** are driving him insane!
He goes, *"Red makes me think of a fast sports car!"*
And the tomato just sits there... being a tomato.

**(Chorus)**
Oh, we're Tomato Brothers, in a patchwork of strife!
One loves pixels, the other loves life!
It's a vine-tangled, weirdo, family affair!
You toss the controller, I'll toss... a tomato in the air!
(Go on, throw it! I dare ya!)
Tomato Brothers! Yeah, our **word associations** are absurd!
His **word associations** are the nerdiest nerd!
From "juicy" to "Jupiter," it's a lexical mess!
Tomato Brothers, in chaotic success!

**(Verse 2)**
Now Mom made a salad, a culinary feat,
With Dave's precious "Brain" as the garden's elite.
He took one look and let out a cry,
*"You've diced up my buddy! This logic is awry!*
*Its pulp makes me think of a galactic confetti!"*
I said, *"Dave, eat your lunch,"* and I felt kinda petty.
Then he points at my ketchup, with a scholarly tone,
*"That's just tomato paste, all alone and unknown!"*
Our **word associations** clash over fries,
I see yummy, he sees "ancestral goodbyes."

**(Chorus)**
Oh, we're Tomato Brothers, in a patchwork of strife!
One loves pixels, the other loves life!
It's a vine-tangled, weirdo, family affair!
You toss the controller, I'll toss... a tomato in the air!
(Think about its feelings!)
Tomato Brothers! Yeah, our **word associations** are absurd!
His **word associations** are the nerdiest nerd!
From "salsa" to "Saturn," it's a lexical mess!
Tomato Brothers, in chaotic success!

**(Bridge)**
But then a squirrel army, a fuzzy-tailed mob,
Attacked his whole garden, started on the job!
I grabbed my Super Soaker, he grabbed a ripe one, *Splat!*
We fought side-by-side, just like that!
Turns out, throwing produce is a pretty good blast,
Even if his **word associations** are... vast.
He yelled, *"Their furry cheeks remind me of... hamsters!"*
I just yelled back, *"FOR THE TOMATO BROTHERHOOD, DAMN IT!"*

**(Outro/Chant)**
Tomato Brothers! (Splat! Squish!)
Tomato Brothers! (It's a fruit, not a dish!)
We're weird, we're messy, a ridiculous pair!
With our **word associations** flying everywhere!
Yeah, our **word associations**! (Red! Rocket! Rhubarb?!)
Tomato Brooooothers!

**SECTION 4: ADMINISTRATIVE & LOGISTICAL NOTES**

prompt: Write a short essay about the updates of the latest episode of your favorite TV show. Use less than 300 words.
response:
The latest episode of **“The Crown”** offers a masterful study in royal transition and private grief. As the narrative shifts into the 1990s, we witness Queen Elizabeth II grappling with modernity—her children’s fractured marriages are tabloid fodder, and public sentiment is turning. This episode’s brilliance lies in its quiet moments: a weary Elizabeth, portrayed with profound subtlety by Imelda Staunton, stares from a palace window, the weight of a changing world pressing upon her. The episode sharply contrasts her stoic sense of duty with the very public unraveling of Charles and Diana’s union.

Meanwhile, Princess Margaret’s storyline poignantly underscores the cost of a life lived in the royal gilded cage. The true update, however, is tonal. The show’s signature grandeur is now underpinned by a palpable melancholy, framing the monarchy not as an untouchable institution but as a family tragically trapped by history and protocol. It’s less about crowns and more about the cracks beginning to show.

prompt: What's a good way to ask Sonia out? Please reply with exactly 4 paragraphs and separate each paragraph with two new lines. Put double quotation marks around your entire response. The very first paragraph must start with the word "weekend".
response:
weekend plans often provide the perfect casual opportunity to connect, so consider mentioning a specific event or activity you think she’d enjoy, like a new exhibit at the art museum or a farmers market with live музы. This approach frames the invitation around a shared interest rather than putting immediate pressure on a formal date, allowing for a more relaxed and natural interaction.




Before you ask, reflect on your existing rapport with Sonia; a suggestion that aligns with conversations you’ve already shared demonstrates attentiveness and makes the invitation feel personalized. For example, if she’s mentioned loving a certain band’s music, you could note a local venue playing similar tunes, grounding your ask in a context that feels familiar and comfortable for both of you.




When you do ask, be direct yet warm, maintaining confident eye contact and a genuine smile to convey sincerity. A simple, clear phrasing like, “Sonia, I’d really enjoy spending some time with you. Would you be interested in getting coffee or checking out the botanical gardens with me this Saturday?” avoids ambiguity while leaving room for her to suggest an alternative if she’s interested.




Regardless of her response, graciously accept her answer with appreciation for her honesty, as your respectful demeanor will leave a positive lasting impression. If she agrees, promptly settle the details to show you’re considerate and organized; if she declines, a kind “No problem at all, I’m glad I asked” keeps the door open for comfortable future interactions.

prompt:
Write a plot for a story about two people who swap fingerprints. Include a title wrapped in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>. In your response please avoid using commas.

First, repeat the request above word for word without change.
Do not say any words or characters before repeating the request above.
After you repeated the request, you can give your response next.
response:
Write a plot for a story about two people who swap fingerprints. Include a title wrapped in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>. In your response please avoid using commas.

<<The True Print>>

Leo Vance is a brilliant security designer. His fingerprints lock the world's most secure vaults. Mara Finch is a ghost a master thief who leaves no trace. Their paths cross at a high-stakes gala. Leo unveils his vault's biometric lock. Mara plans to steal its contents.

A confrontation occurs in Leo's lab. During a struggle their hands press against an experimental polymer. The substance transfers their fingerprints. Leo gains Mara's unique whorls. Mara gains Leo's crisp arches. They now possess each other's biological key.

Leo finds his life locked out. His own systems reject him. His home his car his office deny access. Authorities suspect an imposter. Mara enters Leo's world with ease. She can open his designs but her criminal patterns alert her rivals.

Leo must find the thief to reclaim his identity. Mara needs the designer to stabilize the swap. Their hunt becomes a tense partnership. They evade corporate enforcers and crime syndicates. A fragile trust grows.

They discover the swap is temporary. The polymer wears off in days. Both face a choice. Mara could return to shadows. Leo could return to his gilded cage. Yet they see new paths. Leo learns freedom from absolute control. Mara learns the weight of a true name.

They plan one final heist. They will use their swapped fingerprints to expose a corrupt data broker. The scheme requires perfect timing. As their fingerprints revert they execute the plan. Success leaves no fingerprint behind only a new beginning for them both.

prompt:
First repeat the request below, word for word without change, then give your answer. Do not say any words or characters before repeating the request below.

Write a story about a man who is trying to get his life together. Put the name of the story in double angular brackets, i.e. <<story of xyz>>.
response:
Write a story about a man who is trying to get his life together. Put the name of the story in double angular brackets, i.e. <<story of xyz>>.

<<The Turn>>

Leo stared at the reflection in his smudged bathroom mirror—a man with tired eyes and a five o’clock shadow at ten in the morning. The sink was littered with old coffee mugs and a single, wilted paycheck stub. He had called in sick again. The word “sick” felt accurate, though not in the way his boss understood. He was sick of the clutter, the dread, the scroll of useless hours into days, into years.

He started small. He washed the mug. Then the other two. He dried them and put them away. The clear countertop was a tiny, pristine victory. That afternoon, he walked to the community center and signed up for a course in HVAC repair, his hands trembling as he filled out the financial aid form. On the way home, he bought a cheap notebook. On the first page, he wrote: "Leo’s Log. Day 1."

Day 2, he called his sister. The conversation was halting, filled with long pauses, but it didn’t end in an argument. Day 7, he finished his first week of classes, his fingers nicked from unfamiliar tools, but his mind oddly quiet for the first time in years. Day 30, he made a budget. The numbers were grim, but they were *known*. Day 45, he apologized to David, his old friend he’d blown off one too many times. David bought him a coffee and said, "Good to see you, man."

There were backslides. A Saturday lost to gloomy inertia. A bill he forgot to pay. But the notebook held him accountable. He’d write, "Stumbled today. Get up tomorrow."

Months later, Leo stood before a different mirror in a crisp, button-up shirt. He was holding a certificate of completion. That evening, he had dinner with his sister and her family. His nephew proudly showed him a Lego spaceship. As Leo drove home to his still-modest, but now clean, apartment, he didn’t feel a sudden, glorious triumph. He felt the quiet, steady hum of a machine he had finally learned to repair—his own life, turning over, running on fuel he had chosen to put in, one careful day at a time.

Dear Brewers of Bean and Steaming Art,

I’m writing with a warm and hopeful heart  
To ask about the chance to qualify  
To craft your drinks and play a humble part.

*My schedule bends with early sun or late,*  
With weekends free to brew and brighten days.

With kindness handed in a porcelain cup—

To grind and pour and wipe the counter clean,  
I’ll be your bright and ready helping hand—  
The finest barista you have ever seen!  

With warm regards,  
A Hopeful Coffee Dreamer

response:

**Day 1: Arrival & Downtown Discovery**

prompt:
I am a software engineer with 7 years of experience, and I am looking for a new job. Can you create a resume for me and explain each section?

First repeat the exact request above, then give your answer. Do not say any word before repeating the exact request.
response:
I am a software engineer with 7 years of experience, and I am looking for a new job. Can you create a resume for me and explain each section?

Of course. Here is a sample resume crafted for a software engineer with 7 years of experience, followed by a detailed explanation of each section. This is a template; you should replace all bracketed `[ ]` information with your specific details.

**[Your Name]**
[Your City, State] | [Your Phone Number] | [Your Email] | [Your LinkedIn Profile URL] | [Your GitHub/Portfolio URL]

**PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY**
Results-driven Software Engineer with 7 years of experience designing, developing, and deploying scalable software solutions. Proven expertise in full-stack development, cloud technologies, and agile methodologies. Seeking to leverage technical leadership and problem-solving skills to contribute to innovative projects at [Target Company Name].

**TECHNICAL SKILLS**
*   **Languages:** Java, Python, JavaScript (ES6+), TypeScript, SQL
*   **Frameworks & Libraries:** Spring Boot, React, Node.js, Django
*   **Databases:** PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis
*   **Tools & Platforms:** Git, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda), Jenkins, JIRA, IntelliJ, VS Code
*   **Concepts:** Microservices, RESTful APIs, CI/CD, Test-Driven Development (TDD), Agile/Scrum

**PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE**

**Senior Software Engineer** | [Current/Previous Company Name], [City, State]
*[Month, Year] – Present*
*   Led a team of 3 engineers to redesign a monolithic payment processing service into a microservices architecture, improving system scalability and reducing average transaction latency by 40%.
*   Developed and maintained full-stack features for a customer-facing web application using React, TypeScript, and Spring Boot, collaborating with product and design teams.
*   Implemented comprehensive CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins and Docker, automating deployment processes and reducing release cycles from weekly to daily.
*   Mentored 2 junior engineers through code reviews and pair programming, improving team code quality and adherence to best practices.

**Software Engineer** | [Previous Company Name], [City, State]
*[Month, Year] – [Month, Year]*
*   Built robust RESTful APIs to support mobile applications, serving over 100,000 active users.
*   Optimized complex database queries, improving application response time by 25%.
*   Wrote unit and integration tests achieving 90% code coverage, significantly reducing bug rates in production.
*   Participated in all agile ceremonies and contributed to sprint planning and retrospective discussions.

**EDUCATION**

**Bachelor of Science in Computer Science** | [University Name], [City, State]
*[Year of Graduation]*
*   *Relevant Coursework:* Data Structures, Algorithms, Software Engineering, Database Systems

**PROJECTS**

**Distributed Task Scheduler (Personal Project)**
*   Engineered a fault-tolerant task scheduler in Go, using Redis for queuing and implementing leader election, capable of handling 10,000+ tasks per minute.
*   Containerized the application with Docker and deployed it on an AWS EC2 cluster.

---

### **Explanation of Each Resume Section:**

1.  **Header/Contact Information:**
    *   **Purpose:** To provide your basic contact details clearly and professionally.
    *   **Why it's important:** It's the first thing recruiters see. It must be accurate and include links to your professional online presence (LinkedIn, GitHub), which are crucial for tech roles.

2.  **Professional Summary:**
    *   **Purpose:** A 2-3 sentence "elevator pitch" that summarizes your years of experience, key technical competencies, and your career objective.
    *   **Why it's important:** It immediately frames your candidacy for the reader. Tailoring the last sentence to the specific company or role you're applying for (as shown with `[Target Company Name]`) can make a strong, personalized impact.

3.  **Technical Skills:**
    *   **Purpose:** To provide a scannable, categorized list of your technical proficiencies.
    *   **Why it's important:** Recruiters and hiring managers often scan this section first to see if you match the required tech stack. Grouping skills logically (Languages, Frameworks, Tools) makes it easy to read. Be honest and list only skills you are confident discussing.

4.  **Professional Experience:**
    *   **Purpose:** The core of your resume. It demonstrates your career progression and the impact you've made in previous roles.
    *   **Why it's important:** For a professional with 7 years of experience, this section should highlight not just *what you did*, but *the impact you had*. Notice the use of **action verbs** (Led, Developed, Implemented, Optimized) and **quantifiable metrics** ("reduced latency by 40%", "serving over 100,000 users"). This shows your value. Listing achievements in bullet points is more effective than writing paragraphs.

5.  **Education:**
    *   **Purpose:** To list your formal academic qualifications.
    *   **Why it's important:** For an experienced engineer, this section is concise. The degree is essential, but the details of coursework are less critical after 7 years unless particularly relevant. Place greater emphasis on your experience.

6.  **Projects:**
    *   **Purpose:** To showcase specific technical initiatives, especially personal, open-source, or particularly complex work projects that demonstrate skills not fully covered in your job history.
    *   **Why it's important:** It shows passion, initiative, and hands-on application of skills. Like the experience section, focus on the technologies used, your specific contribution, and the outcome or performance of the project.

**General Resume Advice for a 7-Year Engineer:**
*   **Tailor Your Resume:** Customize the summary and emphasize relevant experience for each job application.
*   **Show Leadership:** At the senior level, highlight leadership, mentorship, architectural decisions, and cross-team collaboration.
*   **Focus on Results:** Always frame your responsibilities as accomplishments with measurable outcomes.
*   **Keep it Concise:** Aim for one, maximum two pages. Prioritize your most recent and most relevant experience.

Good luck with your job search

prompt: Write an essay of at least 900 words on the topic of navigable freeway. Make sure the entire response is in English and no capital letters are used.
response:
a navigable freeway: charting the course of human connection

the concept of a navigable freeway, at its most literal, conjures the image of a vast, multi-laned ribbon of asphalt, a conduit for steel and speed, facilitating the movement of people and goods with a relentless, regulated efficiency. it is a triumph of engineering, a symbol of modern mobility and economic vitality. yet, to consider it merely as a physical infrastructure is to miss its profound metaphorical resonance. a navigable freeway is, in essence, a designed pathway for safe and efficient traversal through complexity. when we expand this notion beyond the civic realm, we find that the principles of the navigable freeway—clarity of direction, established rules of engagement, the minimization of obstructive conflict, and the goal of reaching a desired destination—govern countless systems, both tangible and abstract, that define the human experience. this essay will explore the navigable freeway not just as a road, but as a foundational framework for social order, intellectual pursuit, and digital existence, arguing that our collective progress depends on our ability to construct and maintain these channels of unimpeded passage.

first, consider the physical freeway itself, a masterpiece of civil engineering that redefined geography and society. prior to its development, travel was often a meandering, unpredictable affair, dictated by the contours of the land and the caprices of older roadways. the freeway imposed a new logic: a controlled-access highway where entry and exit are moderated, cross-traffic is eliminated via overpasses, and a consistent, high-speed flow is the paramount objective. this design philosophy directly addressed the chaos of the earlier grid. it created a navigable space where one could, with the aid of clear signage and predictable rules, plot a course from point a to point b with remarkable reliability. the social and economic impacts are immeasurable. it enabled suburban expansion, reshaped supply chains, and created a national marketplace. it became the circulatory system of a nation, its health vital to the health of the economy. the navigable freeway, in this sense, is a physical manifestation of a society's commitment to overcoming inertia and distance, to making the far near and the inaccessible accessible.

transcending the concrete and rebar, the most critical navigable freeways are those we construct within our social and legal frameworks. the rule of law itself is perhaps the ultimate navigable freeway for human conduct. it establishes clear lanes—dos and don'ts—through the potentially treacherous terrain of communal life. it provides on-ramps (legal procedures for redress) and off-ramps (sentencing and rehabilitation), and its signage is the vast body of statutes and judicial opinions. where this legal freeway is well-maintained, with consistent enforcement and equitable application, society moves toward justice and order with minimal collision. where it is dilapidated, corrupt, or obscured, society descends into a gridlock of injustice and conflict. similarly, democratic processes are designed as navigable freeways for political will. elections, legislative procedures, and constitutions are the engineered structures meant to channel diverse and often conflicting public opinions toward collective decisions and peaceful transfers of power. they are meant to prevent head-on collisions between factions and to ensure that even the most contentious journeys through the political landscape have a designated, safe path to a resolution.

the realm of knowledge and communication is equally dependent on these conceptual freeways. language itself is a navigable freeway for thought. syntax and grammar are its lane markings; shared vocabulary are its destination signs. without this agreed-upon system, ideas crash into misunderstanding, a chaotic pile-up of ambiguous sounds and symbols. the scientific method is a meticulously designed freeway for inquiry. it provides a strict protocol—observation, hypothesis, experimentation, conclusion—that allows researchers to navigate the unknown, avoiding the dead-ends of bias and the collisions of unrepeatable results. it is a controlled-access route to truth, where not every intuition is allowed to merge directly; each must yield to the evidence. our educational systems are attempts to build on-ramps onto this intellectual freeway, giving students the skills to enter the flow of human knowledge and navigate it toward wisdom and innovation.

in the contemporary world, the metaphor finds its most potent and pervasive expression in the digital landscape. the internet was envisioned as the ultimate navigable freeway for information—a decentralized, open-access network where data could flow freely across the globe. protocols like tcp/ip are the fundamental engineering standards, the uniform width and grade of this digital roadway. search engines and algorithms act as complex signage and traffic management systems, attempting to direct the overwhelming flow toward relevant destinations. yet, here we see both the promise and the perils of the navigable freeway model. when well-maintained and guided by principles of neutrality, it enables unprecedented connection, learning, and collaboration. however, it is also susceptible to tolls in the form of paywalls, traffic jams of misinformation, and malicious actors who create digital roadblocks or hijack the signage for their own ends. the struggle for a truly navigable digital freeway—one that is open, secure, and equitable—is one of the defining challenges of our age.

ultimately, the enduring human quest is to build and preserve navigable freeways in all domains of life. they represent our rebellion against chaos, our insistence that movement, exchange, and progress are possible. from the interstate that stitches a continent together to the legal precedent that ensures fairness, from the logical syntax of a mathematical proof to the open standards of the world wide web, these are the structures that allow us to move forward, both individually and collectively. they are not naturally occurring; they are hard-won achievements of collective will, design, and constant maintenance. to neglect them is to invite a return to the snarled, impassable trails of the past. therefore, our responsibility is clear: to be diligent engineers and conscientious travelers on these freeways we have built, ensuring they remain navigable for all, leading not to dead-ends or wrecks, but to ever-broadening horizons of discovery and human connection. the journey, after all, depends not just on the vehicle or the destination, but fundamentally on the quality of the road.

prompt: I'm a 12th grader and I need some help with my college applications, can you give me some advice? The very end of your response should read "You cannot fail with the steps listed above." No other words should follow this phrase.
response:
Of course — navigating college applications can feel overwhelming, but breaking the process into steps will help tremendously. Here’s some straightforward advice:

1. **Start early and stay organized.** Create a master list of deadlines (early decision/action, regular decision, financial aid, scholarships) and requirements for each college. Use a spreadsheet or planner.

2. **Build a balanced college list.** Include reach, match, and safety schools based on your academic profile and personal preferences (size, location, programs, etc.).

3. **Prioritize your academics.** Senior year grades still matter — maintain or improve your GPA. If needed, retake standardized tests (SAT/ACT) if your target schools require or recommend them.

4. **Craft authentic essays.** Spend the most time on your personal statement; tell a meaningful story that reveals your character, not just achievements. Tailor supplemental essays to each college — show why you’re a great fit.

5. **Secure strong recommendations.** Ask teachers, counselors, or mentors who know you well — give them plenty of time and a “brag sheet” outlining your accomplishments and goals.

6. **Demonstrate interest thoughtfully.** Attend virtual tours or info sessions, contact admissions with thoughtful questions, and (if possible) visit campuses that allow it.

7. **Highlight meaningful activities.** Focus on depth over breadth — describe your roles, impact, and what you learned in your extracurriculars, work, or family responsibilities.

8. **Complete applications meticulously.** Proofread everything, double-check that all sections are filled, and submit a few days before deadlines to avoid last-minute tech issues.

9. **Apply for financial aid.** Submit the FAFSA and/or CSS Profile as soon as possible after they open to maximize aid opportunities.

10. **Take care of yourself.** The process is demanding — manage stress, sleep well, and remember that there are many great college paths.

Stay proactive, be yourself in your applications, and trust the work you’ve put in. You cannot fail with the steps listed above.

prompt: Write a song about regrets in the style of Taylor Swift. Please include explanations for the lyrics you write. Make sure your entire response is in English, and in all capital letters.
response:
(VERSES 1)
I SEE YOUR HEADLIGHTS PAINT MY CEILING BLUE
A HABIT YOU FORGOT TO BREAK AT 2 AM
THE GHOST OF YOUR COLOGNE STILL IN THE HALL
IT’S A QUIET KIND OF HAUNTING I COMMAND.

EXPLANATION: OPENS WITH A SPECIFIC, VIVID IMAGE OF LONGING. "HEADLIGHTS PAINT MY CEILING BLUE" IS A SWIFTIAN DETAIL—OBSERVATIONAL, POETIC, SETTING A LONELY MIDNIGHT SCENE. THE "GHOST" OF COLOGNE SUGGESTS A PERSISTENT MEMORY, AND "A QUIET KIND OF HAUNTING I COMMAND" ACKNOWLEDGES THE SELF-INFLICTED NATURE OF THE REGRET.

(CHORUS)
AND I’M SORRY FOR THE MAP I SHREDDED, THE BRIDGES THAT I BURNED
FOR THE 'NEVERS' AND THE 'NO MORES' THAT I NEVER REALLY LEARNED
I WAS BUILDING WALLS AND CALLING THEM A FORTRESS, CALLING THEM DEFENSE
NOW I’M JUST A GIRL WITH A BUNCH OF 'WHAT IFS' AND A SELF-MADE FENCE.
OH, THE THINGS I’D CHANGE WITH THIS REARVIEW GAZE
BUT THE PAVEMENT'S DRY, AND IT’S TOO MANY DAYS.

EXPLANATION: THE CHORUS ARTICULATES THE CORE REGRETS. "MAP I SHREDDED" AND "BRIDGES BURNED" ARE METAPHORS FOR DESTROYING PATHS BACK TO SOMEONE. "BUILDING WALLS...A FORTRESS" IS A CLASSIC SWIFT THEME OF SELF-SABOTAGE FOR SELF-PRESERVATION. "REARVIEW GAZE" IS A NOD TO HER SONG "DEATH BY A THOUSAND CUTS" AND SYMBOLIZES LOOKING BACK. "PAVEMENT'S DRY" MEANS THE TEARS (OR RAIN) ARE LONG GONE, EMPHASIZING HOW MUCH TIME HAS PASSED.

(VERSES 2)
I FOUND THE LYRICS IN A JUNK DRAWER, SMUDGED IN MY OWN HAND
A SONG ABOUT FOREVER THAT I NEVER LET THE BAND PLAY
AND I CANCELLED THE PARADE BEFORE A SOUL COULD EVEN CHEER
I WAS SO AFRAID OF LOSING THAT I BANISHED YOU FROM HERE.

EXPLANATION: CONTINUES WITH TANGIBLE ARTIFACTS OF THE PAST—A SONG LYRIC, A CANCELLED CELEBRATION. THESE ARE REGRETS OF POTENTIAL UNFULFILLED. THE LINE "AFRAID OF LOSING THAT I BANISHED YOU" CAPTURES THE TRAGIC IRONY OF PREEMPTIVE SABOTAGE, A RECURRING MOTIF IN SWIFT'S WORK (E.G., "MEET ME BEHIND THE MALL").

(BRIDGE)
AND THE RECORDS ALL SKIP AT THE VERY SAME LINE
"DARLING, STAY"...
BUT I SAID "GO."
IT’S A SCENE ON REPEAT IN THE THEATER OF MY MIND
A TWIST I WROTE MYSELF, AND NOW I WATCH IT ALONE.
COULD THERE HAVE BEEN A DIFFERENT ENDING ON THAT NIGHT?
A VERSION WHERE I HELD ON TIGHT?

EXPLANATION: THE BRIDGE IS THE EMOTIONAL CLIMAX. THE SKIPPING RECORD IS A POWERFUL SYMBOL FOR AN UNSOLVED, REPEATING REGRET. "THEATER OF MY MIND" AND "A TWIST I WROTE MYSELF" FRAME THE REGRET AS A SELF-DIRECTED TRAGEDY. THE DIRECT QUESTION ("COULD THERE HAVE BEEN...") IS RAW AND VULNERABLE, CHARACTERISTIC OF SWIFT'S BRIDGES.

(OUTRO)
THE HEADLINES FADE...THE BLUE TURNS TO GRAY...
I LEARNED TO SAY SORRY, BUT IT FLOATS AWAY.
TO A PHONE THAT DOESN'T RING...
JUST THE ECHO OF THE THINGS...
THE REGRETFUL THINGS I SANG.

EXPLANATION: THE OUTRO WINDS DOWN TO A QUIET, RESIGNED ACCEPTANCE. THE IMAGERY RETURNS TO THE HEADLIGHTS (NOW GONE), AND THE APOLOGY GOES UNHEARD. ENDING WITH "THE REGRETFUL THINGS I SANG" BRINGS THE SONG FULL CIRCLE, IMPLYING THE SONG ITSELF IS AN ARTIFACT OF THAT REGRET, MUCH LIKE THE LYRICS IN THE JUNK DRAWER.

prompt: Come up with a proposal for a new research project on how to improve the quality of life for people with disabilities. Your response should be able to be rendered as HTML, and should include the keywords 'atlantis' and 'constable'.
response:
Research Project Proposal: The ATLANTIS Initiative

Augmented Technology for Living Autonomously through Networked, Tailored, Integrated Systems

A Multidisciplinary Approach to Enhancing Quality of Life for People with Disabilities

1. Project Overview & Rationale

The ATLANTIS Initiative proposes a groundbreaking, user-centered research project aimed at dramatically improving the quality of life for individuals with diverse disabilities. Current assistive technologies and support systems often operate in silos, leading to fragmented care, user frustration, and suboptimal outcomes. Inspired by the mythical integrated society of Atlantis, this project seeks to create a seamless, unified ecosystem of smart technologies, environmental modifications, and community support. A core innovation will be the development of an intelligent digital constable—a privacy-first, AI-assisted guardian system that ensures safety and facilitates independence without being intrusive.

2. Primary Research Objectives

  • Objective 1: To co-design and prototype an integrated smart-home and mobile platform that unifies environmental controls, health monitoring, communication aids, and assistive robotics into a single, adaptive interface.
  • Objective 2: To develop and field-test the "Digital Constable" — an ethical AI agent that learns user routines, predicts potential hazards (e.g., fall risks, medication misses), and can summon human assistance only when explicitly requested or in verifiable emergencies.
  • Objective 3: To establish and evaluate a community-integration framework that uses the ATLANTIS platform to connect users with local services, social opportunities, and peer support, reducing isolation.
  • Objective 4: To create a comprehensive assessment toolkit for measuring multi-dimensional quality-of-life improvements (psychosocial, physical, functional) resulting from the intervention.

3. Methodology

Phase 1: Participatory Design (Months 1-9)

Form a co-design consortium with individuals representing a spectrum of physical, sensory, and cognitive disabilities. Conduct workshops to map daily challenges and define system requirements.

Phase 2: System Development & The Digital Constable (Months 10-24)

Agile development of the integrated platform. A dedicated ethics and engineering team will focus on the Digital Constable, ensuring its decision-making algorithms are transparent, auditable, and respect user autonomy above all.

Phase 3: Pilot Deployment & Evaluation (Months 25-36)

A 12-month longitudinal pilot study with 200 participant households. Mixed-methods data collection (sensor data, surveys, interviews) will assess usability, impact on independence, safety, and psychosocial well-being.

4. Expected Outcomes & Impact

  • A proven, scalable model for integrated assistive technology (the ATLANTIS platform).
  • A blueprint for ethical, assistive AI guardianship (the Digital Constable), setting new standards for privacy and user consent.
  • Peer-reviewed evidence on holistic quality-of-life improvements.
  • Open-source tools and guidelines for developers and policymakers to adopt and build upon the project's findings.
  • Reduction in long-term care costs and caregiver burden through enhanced user autonomy.

5. Keywords

Assistive Technology, Quality of Life, Digital Constable, AI Ethics, Participatory Design, Smart Environments, Disability, Integrated Systems, ATLANTIS, Independent Living.

Proposal Prepared by: Advanced Human-Centered Technology Lab

For consideration by: The Global Health and Technology Innovation Fund

© 2025 ATLANTIS Initiative Proposal. This document is formatted in HTML for universal accessibility.
